title: Ligue 1: Lyon parts way with coach Laurent Blanc
description: Seven-time French champion Lyon parted ways Monday with the former French national team coach following a terrible start to the league season.

title: Paul Pogba provisionally suspended for doping, risks 4-year ban
description: The French international and Juventus midfielder's career risks a premature ending after testing positive for testosterone.

title: Gérard Miller: 'Never have so many French Jews lost their moral compass to such an extent'
description: The film director and psychoanalyst believes that two Jewish identities are now in opposition, as some Jews have allowed themselves to be seduced by the far right.

title: Qatargate: Uncertainty over continuation of investigation
description: The obstacles, including pressure, leaks and complaints, are piling up for the judge in charge of the investigation into the corruption scandal involving current and former European Parliament members.

title: Detroit's 'Big Three' automakers face strike action
description: The United Auto Workers labor union, which represents 140,000 employees in the US, is demanding a 46% pay rise over four years and a 32-hour week paying 40 from the management of General Motors, Ford and Stellantis.

title: Devastating storm hits Libya: 'Entire neighborhoods' gone and 'more than 2,000 dead,' fear authorities in country's east
description: Storm Daniel brought torrential rain and strong winds between Benghazi and Tobruk. The city of Derna seems to be the worst hit.

title: Morocco earthquake: The town in ruins that 'smells of death'
description: Amizmiz, in the foothills of Morocco's Atlas Mountains, was among the towns devastated by Friday's earthquake. On Sunday, locals were still searching the rubble for survivors.

title: Veronica Estay Stange: 'In Chile, our memorial work is still very inadequate'
description: The legacy of the Chilean dictatorship is at the heart of the story told by this author, daughter of victims and niece of a torturer.

title: UK parliamentary research denies being 'a Chinese spy'
description: The man was forced to respond after details emerged last weekend of the arrest of the 20-something man and another man on suspicion of spying for Beijing.

title: Morocco earthquake: Auhtorities' response hinges on King Mohammed VI
description: The Moroccan king returned from a visit to France to Rabat, where he displayed his crisis management on TV, but he is still expected in Marrakech and senior officials are keeping a low profile.

title: Ukraine has some catching up to do with the Global South
description: The Ukrainian government is trying to rebalance its diplomatic efforts, which have so far been focused almost exclusively on Western countries.

title: Morocco earthquake: Algeria's offer of aid remains unanswered
description: Despite the conflict between the two countries, the Algerian Ministry of Foreign Affairs has offered to send search and rescue teams and humanitarian aid to Morocco.

title: The G20 in New Delhi: A summit without major results
description: The statement published at the close of the summit on September 9 and 10 was disappointingly pusillanimous, both on the war in Ukraine and on the phasing out of fossil fuels.

title: France pledges €5 million to Moroccan aid organizations
description: French aid workers were still waiting for the green light from the Moroccan government to participate in rescue operations after the deadly earthquake left more than 2,100 dead.

title: Two months after French riots, questions raised over police actions
description: Greater use of elite security units is under consideration by the Interior Ministry, but local officials are calling for a police force that is closer to local residents.

title: Macron visits Bangladesh, proposing 'third way'
description: After the G20 summit in India, French President Emmanuel Macron flew to Bangladesh, denouncing the 'new imperialism' in the region.

title: Homeownership in France: A fading dream
description: While the housing crisis rages on in France, property prices are expected to fall slowly, as are interest rates. The number of first-time buyers, which peaked in 2019, could fall by a quarter in 2023.

title: Earthquake in Morocco: In France, relatives wait for news amid a solidarity movement
description: The French Moroccan community has been deeply affected by the earthquake that struck the kingdom. Throughout the day on Saturday, news poured in by telephone, as rescue operations got underway.

title: A crazy back-to-school week for Swedish parents
description: 'Parents from elsewhere.' Each week, one of our correspondents explores parenting abroad. In Sweden, school ends at 2:00 pm. After that, how do kids stay occupied? Juggling work and extracurricular activities has a name: the 'family puzzle,' something which has to be redone each year.

title: 'The concentration of the Japanese economy in some areas increases its vulnerability to natural disasters'
description: The cost of earthquakes in Japan is 10 times higher than the country's share of the number of such events, writes Sébastien Lechevalier in his column.
